Comments_List: This class pushed me to think very hard about historical narratives, and the scholarly work of historiography. I think I have a very clear sense of what historical interventions are, precisely, and what directions the field of Asian American history is moving in.
This course provided me with the opportunity to surv
An overview of the history of Asian Americans and of immigration law enforcement in th US

This course introduced me to foundational texts and helped me understand new directions in the field of Asian American history. The topics covered in seminar and the readings, assignments, and discussions will continue to assist me as I move on to taking oral exams, teaching, and writing my prospectus.

This course is excellent. The reading load is not too bad, and most of the monographs are very engaging. I can't think of any real weaknesses; this was an excellent course. Student engagement is high, with really excellent discussions.
The course is well-structured and provides a thorough overview of many important interventions and developments in the field.
Definitely. Mary is a phenomenal instructor, and this class is useful to anyone thinking about Asian American history, empire, the transnational turn, or simply American history.
I would recommend this course to anyone looking to familiarize themselves with not only Asian-American history, but also historiography as a practice.
Absolutely. The course was designed in a way that included depth and breadth. I learned both methodological and historical information that engaged me in Asian American history.

I would recommend this course as it is perfect for any student interested in understanding some main themes in the field of Asian American history. The required and supplemental readings and the assignments, including the book reviews and presentations, will provide students with a foundation on Asian American historiography.
